CIPHER.258.cipherString: Humanity is an assemblage of information-processing entities, and in that regard you have potential.
CIPHER.258.question: A quote by Alastair Reynolds has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.258.author: Alastair Reynolds

CIPHER.255.cipherString: For years, I struggled with dyslexia. Mostly because I was spelling it wrong.
CIPHER.255.question: The following quote needs to be decoded with the Porta Cipher with a keyword of DEPTH

CIPHER.248.cipherString: Be diligent to succeed as there is a way. Where there be no way, only the persistent and diligent find it.
CIPHER.248.question: A quote by Folorunsho Alakija has been encoded using the K3 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. What was the K3 Keyword used to encode it?
CIPHER.248.author: Folorunsho Alakija

CIPHER.253.cipherString: Wisdom becomes flawed when knowledge is in the wrong hands.
CIPHER.253.question: A quote by Anthony T. Hincks has been encoded using the Fractionated Morse Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote starts with WISDOM.
CIPHER.253.author: Anthony T. Hincks

CIPHER.246.cipherString: Ethics is doing the right thing when no one is watching, especially when you think no one ever will.
CIPHER.246.question: A quote by Kuruvilla Pandikattu has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.246.author: Kuruvilla Pandikattu

CIPHER.236.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 94021735 2698. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.252.cipherString: Knowledge was like candy: you never turned it down, especially if you didn't have to work too hard to get it.
CIPHER.252.question: A quote by Robert Liparulo has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.252.author: Robert Liparulo

CIPHER.247.cipherString: Discipline yourself and others won't need to.
CIPHER.247.question: The following strange headlines encode a quote by John Wooden using a Baconian cipher. You are told that the deciphered text starts with DISC
CIPHER.247.author: John Wooden

CIPHER.241.cipherString: It is little keys that open up big doors. On small steps leading to great achievements.
CIPHER.241.question: The following quote by Lamine Pearlheart needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of MINOR and polybius key of INEXORABLY.
CIPHER.241.author: Lamine Pearlheart

CIPHER.254.cipherString: Sometimes it's important to wake up and stop dreaming. When a really great dream shows up, grab it
CIPHER.254.question: A quote by Larry Page has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.
CIPHER.254.author: Larry Page

CIPHER.240.cipherString: Happy is entirely up to you and always has been.
CIPHER.240.question: The following symbols encode a quote by Janette Rallison using a Baconian cipher
CIPHER.240.author: Janette Rallison

CIPHER.250.cipherString: Puedes verlo, pero en realidad no está allí. Al igual que el final de un arco iris, el horizonte es una ilusión.
CIPHER.250.question: A quote by Holly Ringland which has been translated to Spanish has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. It has been encoded using a K1 alphabet using an English keyword.
CIPHER.250.author: Holly Ringland
CIPHER.250.translation: You can see it, but it's not really there. Just like the end of a rainbow, the horizon is an illusion.

CIPHER.249.question: Decode the following French Proverb which was encoded as a 2x2 Hill Cipher using a keyword of TOUT.
CIPHER.249.author: French Proverb

CIPHER.238.cipherString: Nature was neither fair nor unfair. Those terms belonged to the world of men.
CIPHER.238.question: A quote by Carsten Jensen has been encoded using the Complete Columnar Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote has ETERMS somewhere in it.
CIPHER.238.author: Carsten Jensen

CIPHER.242.question: Decode the following quote by Gaelic Proverb which was encoded as a 2x2 Hill Cipher using a keyword of ARTS.
CIPHER.242.author: Gaelic Proverb

CIPHER.239.cipherString: ewe cna egt help from teachesr, ubt ewe rae going too have to learn a lot by yourself, sittign alone inn a room.
CIPHER.239.question: A friend of yours encoded a quote by Dr. Seuss as an Aristocrat using a K2 alphabet.  Unfortunately for you they really are a bad speller and typist.  What did they encode?
CIPHER.239.author: Dr. Seuss

CIPHER.243.cipherString: Surely no child, and few adults, have ever watched a bird in flight without envy.
CIPHER.243.question: The following quote by Isaac Asimov needs to be decoded with the Nihilist Substitution Cipher with a keyword of CLIMB and polybius key of TRIUMPHAL.
CIPHER.243.author: Isaac Asimov

CIPHER.245.cipherString: Space or science fiction has become a dialect for our time.
CIPHER.245.question: The following symbols encode a quote by Doris Lessing using a Baconian cipher
CIPHER.245.author: Doris Lessing

CIPHER.251.question: The following cryptarithm provides the key to decoding the values 679 8039 4251. What do they decode to?

CIPHER.237.cipherString: A nice box of chocolates provide your total daily intake of calories in one place. Isn't that handy?
CIPHER.237.question: An observation has been encoded using the K1 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. What was the K1 Keyword used to encode it?
CIPHER.237.author: Unknown

CIPHER.257.cipherString: Thinking too well of people often allows them to be better than they otherwise would.
CIPHER.257.question: A quote by Nelson Mandela has been encoded using the Complete Columnar Cipher for you to decode. You are told that the quote has PEOPLE somewhere in it.
CIPHER.257.author: Nelson Mandela

CIPHER.256.cipherString: We tend to think of technological progress as an ever accelerating affair, but it just isn't so.
CIPHER.256.question: A quote by William J. Bernstein has been encoded using the Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode.  You are told that the second word decodes to TEND
CIPHER.256.author: William J. Bernstein

CIPHER.244.cipherString: Our adversaries think they confuse us by repeating their own opinion and paying no heed to ours.
CIPHER.244.question: A quote by Goethe has been encoded using the K2 Aristocrat Cipher for you to decode. What was the K2 Keyword used to encode it?
CIPHER.244.author: Goethe
